body_html:
@Yuliang-Zou did you delete your Caffe2 repo and clone the pytorch repo? A simple git pull is not enough to get the latest code after the merge.

These are the instructions to build from source with Anaconda https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path . This install path shouldn't need sudo access, but that wouldn't cause the problem you're seeing anyways.
body_text:
@Yuliang-Zou did you delete your Caffe2 repo and clone the pytorch repo? A simple git pull is not enough to get the latest code after the merge.
These are the instructions to build from source with Anaconda https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path . This install path shouldn't need sudo access, but that wouldn't cause the problem you're seeing anyways.
body:
@Yuliang-Zou did you delete your Caffe2 repo and clone the pytorch repo? A simple git pull is not enough to get the latest code after the merge.

These are the instructions to build from source with Anaconda https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path . This install path shouldn't need sudo access, but that wouldn't cause the problem you're seeing anyways.
